intro: Azalea keysii, commonly known as the Key Island azalea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Caribbean, particularly the Bahamas. It is a member of the Rhododendron genus and belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, depending on the variety. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and requires partial shade to full sun for optimal growth. Azalea keysii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a landscape plant in warm climates.
